definition: head-on/red-handed
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to succeed by a lucky stroke

sentences.english: He didn't hit out, but hit the wicket by a fluke.
sentences.chinese: 他并未用力击球，却歪打正着击中了三柱门。

sentences.english: As soon as the slave got back into town, he was captured by his former master.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶一回到镇中，马上就被他的前任主人逮个正着。

sentences.english: Like when you cheat on exams and the teacher caught you.
sentences.chinese: 就像考试作弊被老师当场抓个正着一样。

sentences.english: Amy's brother was caught red-handed at the scene of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 艾米的哥哥在犯罪现场被逮了个正着。

sentences.english: The police caught the criminal red - handed as he came out of the bank carrying a large bag of money .
sentences.chinese: 当罪犯扛着一大袋钱走出银行时，让警察逮了个正着。
我男朋友被我抓了个正着。

sentences.english: Along came Neddy Buttercup, walking forwards, right side up.
sentences.chinese: 他们遇到了马毛茛，向前走，正着走。

sentences.english: If you can't drive up the hill forwards, you'll have to back the car up.
sentences.chinese: 假如你不能把轿车正着开上山，就只好倒着开上去。

sentences.english: We want regulators to work cooperatively but not be captured by those they monitor.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望监管者互相合作但是又不会被上司逮个正着。

sentences.english: They were caught red-handed after being spotted by a neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 他们在作案中被邻居逮了个正着。

sentences.english: I caught my daughter red-handed trying to take money out of my purse.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿想从我的钱包里拿钱，被我抓个正着。

sentences.english: He was caught smoking behind the bike shed.
sentences.chinese: 他在自行车棚后面吸烟时被抓了个正着。

sentences.english: When Bill came home invisible she caught him.
sentences.chinese: 比尔隐形回到家里，被太太逮了个正着。

sentences.english: Three people talking is entered YangGuang heard red-handed.
sentences.chinese: 三人的谈话被进屋的杨广听了个正着。

sentences.english: If we can avoid confrontation, that's the best case scenario.
sentences.chinese: 如果不被人逮个正着，那这就是最棒的一出戏了。

sentences.english: The potato chips were invented by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 土豆条的发明纯属歪打正着。

definition: unexpectedly/suddenly/at unawares/off guard/against expectations
to meet head-on/face-to-face/directly
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to meet by accident
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
resolutely/firmly/ferociously/ruthlessly
at the scene/on the spot
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
confused/distracted
directly/head-on (collision)/in one's face (of wind)
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
in order/in sequence/close to/adjacent to
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
(coll.) poor devil/unfortunate man
